security_audit.summary: Documentation and utility skill with no dangerous capabilities. Contains Python scripts for validation and template generation only. No network access, no command execution, no external file access beyond its own directory. Pure guidance content.

content.user_title: Design tools for effective agent use
content.value_statement: Agent systems struggle with poorly designed tools that cause failures no prompt engineering can fix. This skill provides proven patterns for creating tool APIs that agents can understand, select correctly, and use reliably.
actual_capabilities: Apply the consolidation principle to reduce tool ambiguity
Write tool descriptions that clearly answer what, when, and what returns
Design error messages that enable agent recovery
Implement response format options for token efficiency
Create naming conventions and namespacing for tool collections
Evaluate tool descriptions against clarity, completeness, and actionability criteria
limitations: Does not execute or test tools in live environments
Does not generate working code implementations
Does not integrate with external tool registries or MCP servers
Does not provide runtime monitoring or analytics

use_cases.title: Design new agent tools
use_cases.description: Create tool APIs from scratch with descriptions agents can reliably use and understand

use_cases.title: Debug tool failures
use_cases.description: Diagnose why agents misuse tools and redesign descriptions for better outcomes

use_cases.title: Optimize tool collections
use_cases.description: Evaluate and improve existing tool sets to reduce agent confusion and improve performance

prompt_templates.title: New tool design
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a tool called [name] that [functionality]. Include the description, parameters, returns, and error cases following best practices.

prompt_templates.title: Description audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this tool description for clarity and completeness. Identify issues and provide an improved version: [tool description]

prompt_templates.title: Error handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Design error messages for [tool name] that enable agents to recover from: [list of error scenarios].

prompt_templates.title: Tool consolidation
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this tool collection and identify consolidation opportunities using the consolidation principle: [list of tools with descriptions].

best_practices: Write descriptions that clearly answer what the tool does, when to use it, and what it returns
Use the consolidation principle: if a human cannot definitively choose a tool, an agent cannot either
Design error messages with agent recovery as the primary consideration, not developer debugging
anti_patterns: Vague descriptions like 'Search the database' that leave too many questions unanswered
Cryptic parameter names like x, val, or param1 that force agents to guess meaning
Missing error handling or generic errors that provide no actionable recovery guidance

faq.question: What tools and platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Principles apply to any agent framework using tool definitions.

faq.question: How many tools should an agent system have?
faq.answer: Research shows 10-20 tools for most applications. Use namespacing for organization if more are needed.

faq.question: How do I integrate with MCP servers?
faq.answer: Use fully qualified names like ServerName:tool_name to avoid conflicts when multiple MCP servers are available.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only provides guidance and templates. No data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why do agents misuse my tools?
faq.answer: Most failures come from ambiguous descriptions, unclear parameter purposes, or missing error recovery guidance.

faq.question: How does this compare to traditional API design?
faq.answer: Agent tool design requires more explicit context. Agents cannot infer intent from system knowledge like human developers can.
